item.title: 法国总统马克龙支持埃塞俄比亚的债务重组努力
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙周六表示全力支持埃塞俄比亚的债务重组努力，并强调需要 "在未来几周内 "迅速解决问题。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron expressed full support on Saturday for Ethiopia's debt restructuring efforts, emphasising the need for a swift resolution "in the coming weeks".】

item.title: 墨西哥总统相信国会将在 2025 年禁止种植转基因玉米
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）周六表示，她预计国会将于明年初批准禁止在该国种植转基因玉米。【原文：Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum expects Congress to approve a ban early next year on planting genetically modified corn in the country, she said on Saturday.】

item.title: 阿尔巴尼亚在少年被杀后禁止 TikTok 一年
item.description: 阿尔巴尼亚上周六宣布对热门短视频应用 TikTok 实施为期一年的禁令，此前一名少年在上个月被杀，引发了人们对社交媒体对儿童影响的担忧。【原文：Albania on Saturday announced a one-year ban on TikTok, the popular short video app, following the killing of a teenager last month that raised fears over the influence of social media on children.】

item.title: 中国尼欧推出 Firefly 品牌，与宝马的 Mini 竞争
item.description: Nio 周六发布了一个名为 "萤火虫"（Firefly）的低成本品牌，并将其视为梅赛德斯的 Smart 和宝马的 Mini 的竞争对手。【原文：Nio unveiled a lower-cost brand named Firefly on Saturday that it touted as a rival to Mercedes' Smart and BMW's Mini in the Chinese electric vehicle maker's latest bid to broaden its customer base and boost sales.】

item.title: 零售商派对城申请破产，将关闭 700 家门店
item.description: 自 COVID-19 大流行以来，Party City 一直在苦苦挣扎，周六，该公司在两年内第二次在美国申请破产保护，计划结束其零售和批发业务。【原文：Party City, which has been struggling since the COVID-19 pandemic, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the United States on Saturday for the second time in two years as it plans to wind down its retail and wholesale operations.】

item.title: 本田和日产考虑共同生产汽车 -Kyodo
item.description: 日本共同社周六在未引述消息来源的情况下报道称，本田和日产正在考虑在对方的工厂生产汽车，作为双方深化合作谈判的一部分。【原文：Honda and Nissan are considering producing vehicles in one another's factories as part of their talks to deepen ties, news agency Kyodo reported on Saturday without citing sources.】

item.title: 谷歌称可能在美国反垄断案中放松搜索交易
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周五提议放宽与苹果等公司的协议，将谷歌设置为新设备的默认搜索引擎，以应对美国关于谷歌非法主导在线搜索的裁决。【原文：Alphabet's Google proposed on Friday a loosening of its agreements with Apple and others to set Google as the default search engine on new devices to address a U.S. ruling that it unlawfully dominates online search.】

item.title: 众议院民主党人称共和党人保护埃隆-马斯克的中国投资
item.description: 众议院拨款委员会的最高民主党人周五表示，国会中的共和党人正在通过废除限制美国投资的条款来保护埃隆-马斯克在中国的投资。【原文：The top Democrat on the House of Representatives Appropriations Committee said on Friday that Republicans in Congress were protecting Elon Musk's Chinese investments by scrapping provisions restricting U.S. investments.】

item.title: 贸易专家组在墨西哥转基因玉米争端案中做出有利于美国的裁决
item.description: 周五，一个贸易争端专家组裁定，墨西哥对美国转基因玉米出口的限制违反了《美国-墨西哥-加拿大协议》，拜登政府在其任期的最后几天取得了重大贸易胜利。【原文：A trade dispute panel ruled on Friday that Mexico's restrictions on U.S. genetically modified corn exports violate the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement, handing the Biden administration a major trade victory in its final days.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，美联储主席巴尔寻求法律建议，因外界猜测特朗普可能将其免职
item.description: 消息人士称，美联储负责监管事务的副主席迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）已寻求法律咨询，以探讨他在面对当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）试图将其免职时的选择，这是即将上任的政府与央行之间可能出现冲突的最新迹象。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair for Supervision Michael Barr has sought legal advice to explore his options against any attempts by President-elect Donald Trump to remove him, sources said, the latest sign that a conflict might be looming between the incoming administration and the central bank.】

item.title: 美国政府停摆再次引发投资者担忧
item.description: 试图避免美国政府关门的混乱过程让投资者看到了即将上任的特朗普政府在实施其议程时将面临的挑战，也为来年的市场增添了一份担忧。【原文：The messy process of trying to avert a U.S. government shutdown offers investors a glimpse into challenges the incoming Trump administration will face in implementing its agenda, adding a market concern for the coming year.】

item.title: Venture Global 申请在纽约证券交易所上市
item.description: 根据周五提交的一份公司文件，Venture Global 已申请将其 A 类普通股在纽约证券交易所上市，股票代码为 "VG"。【原文：Venture Global has applied to list its Class A common stock on NYSE under the symbol "VG", according to a company filing on Friday.】

item.title: 大众汽车与工会同意在德国裁员 3.5 万人，避免罢工
item.description: 周五，大众汽车宣布对其德国业务进行全面改革，包括未来裁员 35,000 多人并降低产能，这是欧洲顶级汽车制造商与工会为避免大规模罢工而达成的最后协议。【原文：Volkswagen announced sweeping changes to its German operations, including more than 35,000 future job cuts and capacity reductions in a last-gasp deal between Europe's top carmaker and unions on Friday to avert mass strikes.】

item.title: ELFA 称，11 月份美国商业设备借款年同比增长超过 8
item.description: 美国设备租赁与融资协会（Equipment Leasing and Finance Association）周五表示，与去年同期相比，11月份美国公司的设备投资融资借贷增加了8.7%。【原文：U.S. companies borrowed 8.7% more to finance equipment investments in November compared with the same period a year earlier, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association said on Friday.】

item.title: OpenAI 推出处于测试阶段的 "o3 "人工智能推理模型
item.description: OpenAI 周五表示，它正在测试新的人工智能推理模型--o3 和 o3 mini，这表明它与谷歌等竞争对手的竞争日益激烈，双方都在努力创造能够解决复杂问题的更智能模型。【原文：OpenAI said on Friday it was testing new reasoning AI models, o3 and o3 mini, in a sign of growing competition with rivals such as Google to create smarter models capable of tackling complex problems.】

item.title: 独家报道新日铁在信中称白宫对注定失败的交易审查施加了不当影响
item.description: 新日铁指控白宫对其 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司的国家安全审查施加了 "不允许的不当影响"，并威胁称如果该交易受阻，将采取法律行动。【原文：Nippon Steel alleges the White House had "impermissible undue influence" over a national security review of its $14.9 billion bid for U.S. Steel and threatened legal action if the deal is blocked.】

item.title: 美国陪审团在针对高通的 Arm 案中陷入僵局，仍在商议中
item.description: 美国特拉华州联邦法院的一个陪审团周五表示，在Arm Holdings起诉高通公司的诉讼中，陪审团被要求解决的一个问题陷入僵局，但仍在审议摆在其面前的另外两个问题。【原文：A jury in U.S. federal court in Delaware on Friday said it was deadlocked on one of the questions that it has been asked to resolve in Arm Holdings' , lawsuit against Qualcomm , but is still deliberating the two other questions before it.】

item.title: 大众汽车与工会就德国工厂和工作岗位达成的协议要点
item.description: 以下是周五大众汽车与工会就该汽车制造商在德国的生产基地和工作岗位达成协议的要点。该协议是经过 70 多个小时的谈判达成的，避免了欧洲最大汽车制造商罢工的幽灵。【原文：Here are the main points of a deal struck on Friday between Volkswagen and unions on the carmaker's German sites and jobs. The agreement followed more than 70 hours of talks and averted the spectre of strikes at Europe's largest carmaker.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，北方石油天然气公司欲收购规模较小的竞争对手花岗岩山脊公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，北方石油天然气公司（Northern Oil and Gas）已向花岗岩岭资源公司（Granite Ridge Resources）提出收购要约，后者是美国一家规模较小的生产商，业务遍及二叠纪和鹰福特等盆地。【原文：Northern Oil and Gas has made an acquisition offer for Granite Ridge Resources , a smaller U.S. producer with operations in basins including the Permian and Eagle Ford, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 大众汽车到 2030 年将在德国裁员 35,000 多人
item.description: 大众汽车周五表示，该公司已与工会达成一致，将本着对社会负责的态度，到 2030 年在其德国生产基地裁员 35,000 多人，这将有助于实现超过 150 亿欧元（156.5 亿美元）的增效。【原文：Volkswagen on Friday said it had agreed with unions to cut more than 35,000 jobs at its German sites by 2030 in a socially responsible manner, which would help achieve more than 15 billion euros ($15.65 billion) in efficiency gains.】

item.title: 美国石油和天然气钻井平台数量连续第二周保持不变 - 贝克休斯
item.description: 能源服务公司贝克休斯（Baker Hughes）周五在其密切关注的报告中称，本周美国能源公司的石油和天然气钻井平台数量连续第二周保持不变。【原文：U.S. energy firms this week kept the number of oil and natural gas rigs unchanged for the second week in a row, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Friday.】

item.title: 美国为三星电子和德州仪器敲定高达 63.5 亿美元的芯片赔偿金
item.description: 美国商务部周五表示，将最终确定向韩国三星电子和德州仪器分别拨款 47.45 亿美元和 16.1 亿美元，用于扩大芯片生产。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department said Friday it was finalizing an award of up to $4.745 billion to South Korea's Samsung Electronics and up to $1.61 billion for Texas Instruments to expand chips production.】

item.title: TikTok 潜在竞购者物色首席执行官，准备全面改革业务
item.description: 美国亿万富翁商人弗兰克-麦考特告诉路透社，他正在对 TikTok 的商业模式进行根本性改革，作为竞购中国短视频应用计划的一部分。【原文：U.S. billionaire businessman Frank McCourt is crafting a fundamental overhaul of TikTok's business model as part of a plan to bid for the Chinese-owned short-form video app, he told Reuters.】

item.title: 行业组织称，11 月份得克萨斯州石油业上游工作岗位下滑
item.description: 德克萨斯州独立生产商和版税所有者协会（TIPRO）周五表示，上游石油公司在 11 月份减少了招聘，结束了连续五个月的就业增长。【原文：Upstream oil companies wound down hiring in November, the Texas Independent Producers and Royalty Owners Association (TIPRO) said on Friday, ending five straight months of job growth.】

item.title: 继高盛之后，富国银行又一高调撤离气候银行集团
item.description: 富国银行（Wells Fargo）退出了一个致力于遏制温室气体排放的全球银行集团，在日益增长的政治压力下，越来越多的知名企业退出了气候倡议。【原文：Wells Fargo has withdrawn from a group of global banks committed to curbing greenhouse gas emissions, increasing the number of high-profile firms exiting climate initiatives amid mounting political pressure.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比称政策不确定性导致其改变降息路径
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周五表示，他现在预计2025年的降息路径将比之前更浅，但他补充说，他仍然相信美国央行的政策利率明年将 "明智地 "下降。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee said on Friday he now projects a shallower rate-cutting path in 2025 than he had previously, but added he still believes the U.S. central bank's policy rate will fall a "judicious amount" next year.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士：美国计划将订购华为处理器中发现的台积电芯片的公司列入黑名单
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，拜登政府计划将一家中国公司列入黑名单，这家公司生产的台积电芯片被非法集成到华为的人工智能处理器中。【原文：The Biden administration plans to blacklist a Chinese company whose TSMC-made chip was illegally incorporated into a Huawei AI processor, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国机构建议简化自动驾驶汽车豁免审查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周五提出了一项新流程，以简化对汽车制造商申请豁免的审查，这些制造商希望在没有方向盘或刹车踏板等必要人机控制装置的情况下部署自动驾驶汽车。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Friday proposed a new process to streamline reviews of exemptions filed by automakers seeking to deploy self-driving vehicles without required human controls like steering wheels or brake pedals.】

item.title: 盎格鲁铜矿的诱惑可能考验必和必拓的支出决心
item.description: 两位接近此事的消息人士告诉路透社，全球最大的矿业公司必和必拓需要在英美资源集团股价的基础上至少溢价40%，才能重新提出收购要约。【原文：BHP , the world's biggest miner, would need to offer a minimum 40% premium over Anglo American's share price to make a renewed takeover bid now the rival's value has been boosted by asset sales, two sources close to the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 独家报道：能源部支持的报告称，到 2028 年，美国数据中心的用电量将增加近两倍
item.description: 路透社看到的一份由能源部支持的未公开报告显示，随着美国数据中心行业经历人工智能转型，美国数据中心的电力需求将在未来三年内增长近两倍，耗电量将高达全国电力的 12%。【原文：U.S. data center power demand could nearly triple in the next three years, and consume as much as 12% of the country's electricity, as the industry undergoes an AI transformation, according to an unpublished Department of Energy-backed report seen by Reuters.】
